backend/main.mo: Motoko canister storing messages with timestamped IDs, enforcing a shared password for reading, writing, and clearing.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence mapping features to involved frontend files, components, and related test IDs.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten summaries describing the roles of key frontend chat-related files.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base/theme variables defining a warm color palette for light and dark modes.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point mounting the React app at root and loading main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root component toggling between unlock and chat screens based on stored session password, wrapped in theme provider.
frontend/src/features/chat/ChatScreen.ts: Chat UI showing messages, composer, polling updates, theme toggle, lock control, and clear-chat dialog.
frontend/src/features/chat/chatSession.t: Session storage helpers for saving, retrieving, and clearing the shared password.
frontend/src/features/chat/deviceIdentit: Generates and persists a unique device ID in localStorage for message ownership checks.
Encodes messages with device ID and parses them to distinguish own vs partner messages.
Unlock screen prompting for shared password, verifying it, and storing it in session.
frontend/src/features/chat/useChat.ts: React Query hooks for polling messages, sending messages, clearing chat, and verifying passwords via the canister.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and caches an authenticated or anonymous backend actor and invalidates dependent queries when the identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides Internet Identity context for login, identity loading, and state management using AuthClient.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines Tailwind base layers and theme variables for light and dark modes with custom color tokens.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the app with React, wrapping it in React Query and Internet Identity providers.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Configures Tailwind with custom colors, animations, plugins, and OKLCH-based theme extensions.
